item.title: Help me with this code please :S
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

[quote=“Sanskrit, post:8, topic:367584”][quote author=Keatrm link=topic=463731.msg3392195#msg3392195 date=1289047478]
Technically I beat all of you, I was just dead wrong.
lol, I’m really only in the help section to get help with my 562 not connecting to update server, so I should probably stop helping people :S I’m not good enough with coding yet.
[/quote]
It doesn’ t count if you were dead wrong :rolleyes: anyways, I think this question is answered, time to move on. Repped whattehp406 for beating me ;D[/quote]thanx and always happy to help

@Sanskrit wrote:

replace:

public void skillcape()) {

with:

public void skillcape(); {

you only need “()” for the parameters ;D dammit whattehp beat me to it

item.title: Help me with this code please :S
item.dc:creator: @Keatrm Keatrm
item.description:
@Keatrm wrote:

I believe that means your missing a ; I can try and help you find where you missed it, but I am not a “great” coder.

Let me look through it real quick… lol

Edit:
Okay, now i’m pretty sure this isn’t the problem, but where it says “public void skillcape” put a ; at the end of that line (no spaces after the last character) sorry if I couldn’t help.
Remember i’m not the most porfessional coder around.
